messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 718
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ok, ok, I don t lurk well.  If we haven t met over on another unschooling list, I m brenda, I m in Germany as the wife of an Army guy, and I have a 6
messages.messageBody:
2/4/03 01:27:

> $9. That's a lot. Maybe I just won't take any at all. less work for me if
> I don't have to sit at a booth. But still a little sad not to get to do that.
>

Ok, ok, I don't lurk well. If we haven't "met" over on another unschooling
list, I'm brenda, I'm in Germany as the wife of an Army guy, and I have a 6
year old son. I was going to say that I'm unschooling him, but that seems
kinda obvious.

Sandra, $9 just sounds like a lot because it's not American dollars. When I
came to Germany, everything sounded so expensive because it was deutsch
marks and the exchange rate was 2:1. So a restaurant entree might be
15-30DM; it used to freak me out.

Take the tapes, because people might want them. Couldn't you just tell
people that you have them available and they can get them from you if they
want one? Carry a little bag of them around to meals and stuff, or give
people your room number? Then you don't have to sit at a booth (yuck!), but
they're still available.

brenda
